魏京生.definition: Wei Jingsheng (1950-), Beijing-based Chinese dissident, imprisoned 1978-1993 and 1995-1997, released to the US in 1997

魏伯陽.definition: Wei Boyang (c. 100-170), Chinese author and alchemist

魏國.definition: Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄; Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms

魏巍.definition: Wei Wei (1920-2008), novelist and poet, author of award-winning novel The Orient 東方|东方[Dong1fang1] about the Korean war

魏徵.definition: Wei Zheng (580-643), Tang politician and historian, notorious as a critic, editor of History of the Sui Dynasty 隋書|隋书

魏德邁.definition: Wedemeyer (name); Albert Coady Wedemeyer (1897-1989), US Army commander

魏忠賢.definition: Wei Zhongxian (1568-1627), infamous eunuch politician of late Ming

魏收.definition: Wei Shou (506-572), writer and historian of Northern dynasty Qi 北齊|北齐[Bei3 Qi2], compiler of History of Wei of the Northern dynasties 魏書|魏书[Wei4 shu1]

魏文帝.definition: Cao Pi 曹丕, emperor of Wei 220-226

魏晉南北朝.definition: Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties; generic term for historic period 220-589 between Han and Sui

魏書.definition: History of Wei of the Northern Dynasties, tenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled by Wei Shou 魏收[Wei4 Shou1] in 554 during Northern Qi Dynasty 北齊|北齐[Bei3 Qi2], 114 scrolls

魏格納.definition: Alfred Wegener (1880-1930), German meteorologist and geophysicist, the originator of the theory of continental drift

魏源.definition: Wei Yuan (1794-1857), Qing dynasty thinker, historian and scholar

魏縣.definition: Wei county in Handan 邯鄲|邯郸[Han2 dan1], Hebei

魏都.definition: Weidu district of Xuchang city 許昌市|许昌市[Xu3 chang1 shi4], Henan

魏都區.definition: Weidu district of Xuchang city 許昌市|许昌市[Xu3 chang1 shi4], Henan
